result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jerome L Martin was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court would approve early termination of Probation after 2 years if defendant is able to maintain absolute sobriety.  
Sentence Credit for 149 days was granted if revoked.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

miscConds.notes: Fine/Costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  In Lieu of payment, defendant may also perform community service as directed by Agent.  Agent to modify assessments to account for time performed.

Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Hartland Police Department.
DNA Surcharge waived.

Attendance at the Victim Impact Panel meeting on either February 18, 2015 or the following one, or 30 days jail consecutive.
No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.  Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: First 2 months-Non-Working Hours with Standard Release Conditions.  Last 4 months STAYED and defendant to be released to Day Report Center for compliance for 4 months.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Jerome L Martin in court, in custody, with attorney Michael F Torphy.   Michele Hulgaard and Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 dismissed by operation of law.

Court orders the following: 
- Sentence withheld.  Credit for 149 days if revoked.
- 3 years Probation.  Court would approve early termination of Probation after 2 years if defendant is able to maintain absolute sobriety.
- 36 months Drivers License Revocation. 
- 36 months Ignition Interlock on any vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant 
- Alcohol Assessment
- Attendance at the Victim Impact Panel meeting on either February 18, 2015 or the following one, or 30 days jail consecutive.
- Fine of $1,393.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
- Blood Test Reimbursement of $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Hartland Police Department
- Costs/Fine to be paid as a condition of probation.  In lieu of payment, defendant may also perform community service as directed by agent.  Agent to modify assessments to account for time performed.
- DNA Surcharge waived
- Conditions of Probation:  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.  Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week.
CONDITION TIME: 6 months.  First 2 months - NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  Last 4 months STAYED and defendant to be released to Day Report Center for compliance for 4 months.

records.addlTxt: to Strike Defendant's Third Conviction for Penalty Enhancement Purposes Under Sec. 346.65(2).  Document was originally filed in the associated case, 14TR4227, on 10/28/14 and the heading was amended in court on 11/10/14 to refer to this case instead.

Defendant Jerome L Martin in court with attorney Michael F Torphy.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense will not make a formal request for examination.  Case called for defendant's Motion to Strike Defendant's Third Conviction for Penalty Enhancement Purposes Under Sec. 346.65(2) Wis. Stats.  Court corrects case number in the header of the motion to match this file.  State does not object to the motion.  Court strikes the dates of the third offense from the Information currently on file. Defense requests motion hearing date for Miranda/Goodchild hearing.  Defense to file motion within 10 days.  Court will address motions in the context of the trial.  Defense advises defendant is not being released for work.  Court will not make an order regarding Huber decisions at this time.  Jury status hearing and Jury trial dates to remain on the court's calendar as previously scheduled.
Jury trial - 12 person on December 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on December 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on November 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion in Limine- Prior Criminal Convictions. Filed by the State.

Defendant Jerome L Martin in court with attorney Michael F Torphy. Attorney Katie Bricco appears.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court passes matter for Attorney Bricco and Attorney Torphy is discuss file. Case recalled at 3:07 pm. Defense requests to withdraw the Speedy Trial Demand. Court grants motion for substitution of Attorney's. Court will cancel trial set for October 29, 2014 and reset for trial. Court will also set a further proceedings date to discuss potential competency issues and defense's Motion to Strike Defendant's Third Conviction for Penalty.  Hearing scheduled for November 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury status hearing scheduled for December 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for December 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on October 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Consent and Order for Substitution of Attorney's- Signed by Attorney Smith, Attorney Torphy, and the defendant.

Defendant Jerome L Martin in court with attorney Michael F Torphy.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court will adjourn this matter until October 28, 2014 at 1:30 for the Court to make a decision.  Hearing scheduled for October 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

If no motions in limine are filed the parties do not need to appear.  14TR4227 to tag along and will be addressed through the jury trial.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 27, 2014 at 01:45 pm.

Jury trial - 12 person on October 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on October 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program immediately.  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant to be released directly/only to Wisconsin Community Services personnel to set-up SCRAM monitoring.

Defendant Jerome L Martin in court, in custody, with attorney Katie Beth Bricco.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Margaret Drees, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant would like to look into retaining private counsel.  Defendant to have 2 free phone calls to try to hire counsel.  Defendant has entered a speedy trial demand.  Jury trial expected to last 1 day.  Defense has 20 days from today to file any motions.  If successor counsel is hired, they are to have 10 days from the date they were retained to file any motions.  Defense moves to modify bail.  Arguments by both counsel.  Court grants defendant's motion to modify bail.  Court reduces cash bail to $2,000.00.  Conditions to include:  Defendant not to drive a motor vehicle.  All other conditions to remain as previously set.  If defendant is unable to post, Court orders defendant may have Huber Bailee status.  Jury status hearing scheduled for October 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for October 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jerome L Martin in court, in custody, with attorney Katie Beth Bricco and Legal Intern Evan Nordgren.   Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State presents exhibit #1 marked and received. Officer Paula H. from the Village of Hartland was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense. State rests. No testimony by the defense. State moves for bind over and presents arguments. Defense objects to bind over and presents arguments.   Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Defense counsel presents bail motion arguments.  State presents arguments. Court grants the bail modification. (due to speedy trial demand, parties advised to go to the clerks office to get court date)
